summary: The concept of "quality of life" within the EU legal and regulatory framework encompasses various dimensions that impact individual well-being and societal welfare. It is intrinsically linked to social policies aimed at enhancing living standards, ensuring equitable access to resources, and promoting social inclusion. The EU employs a multifaceted approach to assess quality of life, integrating health, education, and environmental factors into its regulatory measures. By prioritizing quality of life, the EU seeks to foster sustainable development and improve citizens' overall welfare, reflecting its commitment to uphold fundamental rights and enhance social cohesion across member states.
